alert.note: Alert for Lewis (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued August 17 at 1:52PM EDT by NWS Buffalo
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall from Wednesday continues along the Beaver River. * WHERE...A portion of central New York, including the following county, Lewis. * WHEN...Until 500 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Flooding along flood prone shores of the Beaver River is occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 148 PM EDT, The gauge on the Beaver River at Croghan was at 5.8 feet and slowly falling. The high water will continue to result in flooding of some low-lying areas along the river. - Water levels will continue to slowly recede through the rest of this afternoon along the Beaver River. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Croghan, Castorland, Kirschnerville, Belfort, Beaver Falls and Soft Maple Reservoir. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Flooding is occurring or is imminent. It is important to know where you are relative to streams, rivers, or creeks which can become killers in heavy rains. Campers and hikers should avoid streams or creeks.
